alert.note: Alert for Indian River; Martin; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 8:21AM EDT until June 04 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Indian River, Martin and St. Lucie. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 820 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walton, Fort Pierce, Sebastian, Stuart, Vero Beach, Indian River Shores, Jupiter Island, Saint Lucie Nuclear Power Plant, White City, Jensen Beach, Fort Pierce Inlet, Palm City, Indrio, Port Salerno, Vero Beach South, Hobe Sound, Gifford, Winter Beach, Wabasso and Sebastian Highlands. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
